The list goes on. But it all comes down to this: if you believe China is the greatest threat facing our country and we need more resources dedicated to INDOPACOM, this bill is a no brainer.

It also better protects our critical research by including my amendment targeting PLA-affiliated research institutions that steal technology from US campuses. Our universities are on the frontlines of our competition with the CCP, and we can't overlook that any longer.

Importantly, the NDAA also helps protect American companies and promote transparency in American markets by pushing back against Chinese industrial espionage and requiring public reporting of Chinese military companies operating in the United States.

It also requires the NSS to include medicines and medical equipment, and report on the vulnerabilities in our medical supply chain. This pandemic has made us realize we're dangerously dependent on China for these products. The NDAA will help make sure that's no longer the case.

Thanks to the hard work of @MacTXPress, the bill invests $2.2 billion in establishing a Pacific Deterrence Initiative. This will help modernize and strengthen our posture and capability in the Indo-Pacific region and help our friends better deter against Chinese malign behavior.

As we work w/ the @StateDept, @CBP, and @USPS to redouble efforts to comply w/ the #STOPAct to block illicit drugs before they arrive in our communities, it’s also critical to work w/ law enforcement and the tech industry to figure out how we can take these drug dealers offline.

Given where the drugs are coming from and where our trading partners are in providing the package data we’re seeking, Congress and the public need to understand—starting now—how we’re going to avoid disruption and delays once the STOP Act goes fully into effect.

There are serious concerns about mail delays, with potentially 130k mail pieces a day that could be held up or returned to their sender. This is unacceptable, especially at a time when Americans are being told to avoid inessential travel or trips to the stores.

I’m a strong supporter of the data requirements and tough deadlines that were included in the #STOPAct to stop the flow of drugs, but it’s clear that the current administration has fallen down on the job in implementing this program.

The truth is that deadly and illicit drugs can easily be found for sale online. A quick search for “buy fentanyl online no prescription” on search engines like Google or Bing yielded websites that claimed to sell and discreetly ship to American homes. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eo5nmwEW8AgBXB9.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eo5nmwGXYAIf4jD.jpg

While our focus is on the COVID-19 pandemic, we also face a drug overdose crisis that in 2019 claimed over 71,000 lives. That’s why @senrobportman & I held a hearing today on the implementation of the #STOPAct, a program that seeks to stop the flow of drugs into our communities.

There is much work to be done, but the first step is to acknowledge the discriminatory systems in public health & work to address them.
We're also working with @RepPressley to declare racism a national public health emergency & fix our broken & fundamentally racist public health system.

I introduced legislation that will do just that. My bill with @SenWarren invests billions in testing, tracing, & soon, vaccination, to be distributed at the community level with locally based & linguistically appropriate messengers.

If we’re going to solve this crisis, we need to build trust & provide equitable care. Trust will be key in distributing a COVID vaccine when it’s safe & ready with trusted messengers at the community level. We must also ensure that the vaccine is equitably distributed.

On top of that, I know the stress that racism can have on your health on a daily basis. Dealing each and every day with a system that’s stacked against you creates all kinds of underlying conditions that exacerbate health disparities as it relates to COVID.

I’ve experienced it firsthand – I often tell the story of my own mother being turned away from a hospital the day I was born & nearly dying because of discriminatory policies. The lack of quality & equitable care is a national crisis.

From the Tuskegee experiment to HIV/AIDS, there are justifiable reasons why Black and brown communities may have distrust in the government during public health crises. https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/04/us/vaccine-distrust-black-and-latino-americans/index.html

Black, Latinx, Asian & Indigenous people are all dying at disproportionate rates from this virus. That’s because our discriminatory & broken public health system has failed to serve people of color throughout our country’s history.

Soon we’ll have a COVID vaccine - but how do we get people to trust it after years of racism in our public health systems on top of what Trump has already done by setting up another system of distrust in this country? (THREAD)

@tim_fargo Social media. Traditional media. One of the biggest issues, impacting all aspects of the federal government, is that congressional leaders don’t let Congress function as a real legislature. Blaming everything on one party or another prevents this problem from being resolved.

@tim_fargo We have not had a genuine legislative process in the House. The bills that passed here do not reflect the true will of the body; they are the products of coercion. Until people acknowledge this, things won’t get better.

The House majority leader just informed us that “no votes are expected in the House until agreement has been reached.” Think about how insane that is. The point of voting *is* to reach agreement. That’s why we have a legislative branch. This whole damned operation is backward.

Here’s a novel approach to resolving outstanding differences among members of Congress on legislative items: Put legislation on the House and Senate floor and let people amend the bill and vote on various ideas. I know, I know. Crazy.

There is an economic divide when it comes to unwed childbearing. The educated rarely have children outside of marriage, while it's the norm among those with less education. Thus, it seems that many are failing to reap the benefits that many recognize marriage can provide.

Indeed, most Americans still marry or hope to marry. However, marriage ranks relatively low on the list of necessary prerequisites for childbearing, and the nation’s high rate of unwed births is an indication of the disconnection between marriage and children.

Americans overall still appear to place value on marriage and recognize its benefits. While survey results seem to indicate that the desire for marriage has declined relative to other, more individualistic wants and needs, other research suggests Americans still prioritize it.

RT @CBSThisMorning A congressional investigation is raising serious concerns about the safety of some popular children's car booster seats. Disturbing new crash test videos uncovered in that probe reveal how some booster seats are failing to protect children.

@krisvancleave reports. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eo4IXHyXcAU7bZO.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1337015335271198721/vid/480x270/eK92MbR0QlkC65kY.mp4?tag=13

Advocating on behalf of children’s safety is one of the Subcommittee’s first and foremost priorities. Chair @CongressmanRaja and @RepKatiePorter would like YOU to share your experience with booster seats with the Subcommittee.

Share your story here: https://oversight.house.gov/contact/boosterseats

The findings in this investigation are alarming. The Subcommittee calls on @NHTSAgov to enact meaningful booster seat safety regulations and encourage @FTC & state AGs to open consumer protection investigations.

Read the full report here: https://oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/oversight-subcommittee-investigation-reveals-top-booster-seat-manufacturers

The investigation found that manufacturers—Evenflo and Graco—deceptively market their booster seats as “side-impact tested” with weak, no-fail testing conditions. 

It also found that KidsEmbrace does NOT side-impact its booster seats AT ALL.

The Subcommittee obtained videos of industry’s weak and no-fail “side-impact” tests on booster seats that clearly show children under 40lbs. are at great risk of serious injury and death. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1337036827253944320/pu/img/jnZFvzTTJewp5voD.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1337036827253944320/pu/vid/320x400/idoQs6MFrkTuYEmz.mp4?tag=10

Internal docs acquired by the Subcommittee reveal that Evenflo even incurred a $30,000 expense to continue recommending its booster seats for 30-pound children in the US, despite adopting the 40-pound standard in Canada after multiple recalls for selling for smaller children. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eo4ZlllW4AA-09O.jpg

Despite expert consensus that booster seats are not safe for children under 40 pounds, the top manufacturers—Evenflo, Graco, Baby Trend, Artsana, and KidsEmbrace—marketed booster seats for children as light as 30 pounds.

BREAKING: Economic & Consumer Policy Subcmte Chair @CongressmanRaja & @RepKatiePorter released a staff report w/ findings from the investigation into booster seat safety showing that the nation’s top manufacturers endangered children's lives.
